header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 29/2019 ( CNR No. : MHPU01­000114­2019 ) Pravin Deokar Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1] This is an application by Pravin Bharat Deokar for regular bail under Section 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.124/2018 registered under Sections 498­A, 306 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Chikhali, Pimpri, Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of code of criminal procedure
under sections 498­a, 306 read with section 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2] Informant Sunil Bhausaheb Asabe is father of victim deceased Komal. Victim Komal married with Applicant on 10/07/2018. As per Informant, Applicant and co­accused ill­treated victim Komal by suspecting on her character. It is alleged that, present Applicant used to suspect on Komal and used to ill­treat her for domestic reasons. Ultimately, on 23/12/2018 victim Komal committed suicide by hanging herself. One chit came to be seized from the spot and it is alleged that, Applicant is involved in the crime. Hence, the report has been lodged.

argumentSentences.text: 2] Informant Sunil Bhausaheb Asabe is father of victim deceased Komal.
Victim Komal married with Applicant on 10/07/2018.
As per Informant, Applicant and co­accused ill­treated victim Komal by suspecting on her character.
It is alleged that, present Applicant used to suspect on Komal and used to ill­treat her for domestic reasons.
Ultimately, on 23/12/2018 victim Komal committed suicide by hanging herself.
One chit came to be seized from the spot and it is alleged that, Applicant is involved in the crime.
Hence, the report has been lodged.

arguments.text: 3] Applicant submits that, police arrested him on 27/12/2018. He was remanded to MCR. On 29/12/2018. Investigation is over, therefore, his further custody is not necessary. He further submits that, the general allegations are made about abettment to Komal for committing suicide. He never ill­treated Komal, nor intended that, Komal to commit suicide. Hence, he prays for grant of bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicant submits that, police arrested him on 27/12/2018.
He was remanded to MCR.
Investigation is over, therefore, his further custody is not necessary.
He further submits that, the general allegations are made about abettment to Komal for committing suicide.
He never ill­treated Komal, nor intended that, Komal to commit suicide.
Hence, he prays for grant of bail.

arguments.text: 4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer. He submits that, the chit found at the spot pointed out the involvement of Applicant in the crime. Investigation is in progress. Therefore, the application may be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer.
He submits that, the chit found at the spot pointed out the involvement of Applicant in the crime.
Investigation is in progress.
Therefore, the application may be rejected.

arguments.text: 5] Heard the learned Adv. R. K. Patil for Applicant and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State. Perused the Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Heard the learned Adv. R. K. Patil for Applicant and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State.
Perused the Papers.

arguments.text: 6] Prima facie, role attributed to Applicant is to the extent that, he used to suspect on character of Komal and used to ill­treat her. But within short span of marriage, the incident of suicide has taken place. What is the proximate link between the incident and act of Applicant is subject matter of trial. At this stage, investigation with the Applicant is over. Further detention of Applicant is not necessary. If strict conditions are imposed, the purpose of investigation machinery will be served. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 6] Prima facie, role attributed to Applicant is to the extent that, he used to suspect on character of Komal and used to ill­treat her.
But within short span of marriage, the incident of suicide has taken place.
What is the proximate link between the incident and act of Applicant is subject matter of trial.
At this stage, investigation with the Applicant is over.
Further detention of Applicant is not necessary.
If strict conditions are imposed, the purpose of investigation machinery will be served.
Hence, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The Applicant, namely, Pravin Bharat Deokar be released on bail on executing P.R. bond of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand Only) with solvent surety of the like amount in Crime No.124/2018 registered under Sections 498­A, 306 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Chikhali, Pimpri, Pune on the following terms and conditions. ..2.. [i] Applicant to co­operate investigation machinery fully. [ii] Applicant should not contact Informant and witnesses and should not tamper the evidence in the matter. [iii] Applicant to provide proof of his permanent address and contact details to the concern investigation officer. [iv] Applicant should not indulge into any crime. [v] Applicant should not change his address and contact details without prior intimation to investigation officer and the concern Court. 3] Bail before the concern Court of Magistrate. 4] Intimate to the concern Police Station accordingly.

processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 29/2019 ( CNR No. : MHPU01­000114­2019 ) Pravin Deokar Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1] This is an application by Pravin Bharat Deokar for regular bail under Section 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No.124/2018 registered under Sections 498­A, 306 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Chikhali, Pimpri, Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] Informant Sunil Bhausaheb Asabe is father of victim deceased Komal. Victim Komal married with Applicant on 10/07/2018. As per Informant, Applicant and co­accused ill­treated victim Komal by suspecting on her character. It is alleged that, present Applicant used to suspect on Komal and used to ill­treat her for domestic reasons. Ultimately, on 23/12/2018 victim Komal committed suicide by hanging herself. One chit came to be seized from the spot and it is alleged that, Applicant is involved in the crime. Hence, the report has been lodged. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicant submits that, police arrested him on 27/12/2018. He was remanded to MCR. On 29/12/2018. Investigation is over, therefore, his further custody is not necessary. He further submits that, the general allegations are made about abettment to Komal for committing suicide. He never ill­treated Komal, nor intended that, Komal to commit suicide. Hence, he prays for grant of bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer. He submits that, the chit found at the spot pointed out the involvement of Applicant in the crime. Investigation is in progress. Therefore, the application may be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
5] Heard the learned Adv. R. K. Patil for Applicant and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State. Perused the Papers. 
---argument-ends---
6] Prima facie, role attributed to Applicant is to the extent that, he used to suspect on character of Komal and used to ill­treat her. But within short span of marriage, the incident of suicide has taken place. What is the proximate link between the incident and act of Applicant is subject matter of trial. At this stage, investigation with the Applicant is over. Further detention of Applicant is not necessary. If strict conditions are imposed, the purpose of investigation machinery will be served. Hence, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The Applicant, namely, Pravin Bharat Deokar be released on bail on executing P.R. bond of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rupees Fifteen Thousand Only) with solvent surety of the like amount in Crime No.124/2018 registered under Sections 498­A, 306 read with Section 34 of Indian Penal Code at Police Station, Chikhali, Pimpri, Pune on the following terms and conditions. ..2.. [i] Applicant to co­operate investigation machinery fully. [ii] Applicant should not contact Informant and witnesses and should not tamper the evidence in the matter. [iii] Applicant to provide proof of his permanent address and contact details to the concern investigation officer. [iv] Applicant should not indulge into any crime. [v] Applicant should not change his address and contact details without prior intimation to investigation officer and the concern Court. 3] Bail before the concern Court of Magistrate. 4] Intimate to the concern Police Station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
